column4: Woah! I tried changing my resolution from 1024x768 to 800x600, then I tried to activate Desktop Effects (the latter failed). I had to download an NVidia Legacy Driver and reboot; now I can't change my resolution back.
The graphics card is a RIVA TNT2, if I'm not mistaken. Can anyone suggest a way to upsize my resolution again?
Truth be told, *all* of my hardware is old. :)
oh tire, do you have the grfx driver installed?
I believe that installing the (restricted) driver is that cause of the problem.
yeah that's a pretty handy menu ;)
I've been using Ubuntu for a while, so I was looking for "Restricted Drivers" insted.
that menu was removed and merged with "hardware drivers" in last version :)
Rebooting now, let's hope it works.
Yep; I'm back in the joy of 1024x768. :D
My monitor was made in 1997. Go figure. :)
I mean, c'mon. Every time I open the case, I swear I smell rotting wood. ;)
Have some spare time? Treat yourself: http://strife89.deviantart.com/gallery
